medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe lower abdominal pain lasting 3 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started three days prior to admission and was described as crampy, extending from the right lower quadrant to the left lower quadrant. At its worst, the pain was unbearable to move. Pain was refractory to Tums and home remedies but decreased slightly one day prior to admission. The patient experienced weakness and bouts of chills and sweats but denied nausea or vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Significant cardiac history including CABG (5-vessel), stent placement, atrial fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia, insulin-dependent diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, peripheral vascular disease, basal cell carcinoma, anxiety, and an adenoma.
medical_history.family_history: Father had a heart murmur and died at an unspecified age. No family history of early myocardial infarction, arrhythmias, cardiomyopathies, or sudden cardiac death.
